sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using block matrices
message_1:
Solve the following system of equations using block matrices:
$$
\begin{cases}
2x - y + 3z &= 7 \\
3x + 2y + 2z &= 8 \\
x + 2y - 5z &= -5
\end{cases}
$$

Express the solution in the form of a block vector.
message_2:
To solve the system of equations using block matrices, we first need to represent the system as a matrix equation:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & -1 & 3 \\
3 & 2 & 2 \\
1 & 2 & -5
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
7 \\
8 \\
-5
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now, let's find the inverse of the coefficient matrix:

$$
A = \begin{bmatrix}
2 & -1 & 3 \\
3 & 2 & 2 \\
1 & 2 & -5
\end{bmatrix}
$$

To find the inverse of A, we can use the formula:

$$
A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\text{det}(A)} \text{adj}(A)
$$

First, we need to find the determinant of A:

$$
\text{det}(A) = 2(2(-5) - 2(2)) - (-1)(3(-5) - 2(2)) + 3(3(2) - 2(1)) = -20 + 10 + 15 = 5
$$

Now, we need to find the adjugate of A:

$$
\text{adj}(A) = \begin{bmatrix}
(-10) - 4 & (15) - 6 & (-2) - 6 \\
(10) - 6 & (-10) - 9 & 4 - 3 \\
(6) - 6 & (-5) - 9 & 4 - 3
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
-14 & 9 & -8 \\
4 & -19 & 1 \\
0 & -14 & 1
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now we can find the inverse of A:

$$
A^{-1} = \frac{1}{5} \begin{bmatrix}
-14 & 9 & -8 \\
4 & -19 & 1 \\
0 & -14 & 1
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
-2.8 & 1.8 & -1.6 \\
0.8 & -3.8 & 0.2 \\
0 & -2.8 & 0.2
\end{bmatrix}
$$

Now we can find the solution vector by multiplying the inverse of A with the constant vector:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
-2.8 & 1.8 & -1.6 \\
0.8 & -3.8 & 0.2 \\
0 & -2.8 & 0.2
\end{bmatrix}
\begin{bmatrix}
7 \\
8 \\
-5
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
-2.8(7) + 1.8(8) - 1.6(-5) \\
0.8(7) - 3.8(8) + 0.2(-5) \\
-2.8(8) + 0.2(-5)
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
2 \\
-3
\end{bmatrix}
$$

So the solution in the form of a block vector is:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
x \\
y \\
z
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}
1 \\
2 \\
-3
\end{bmatrix}
$$
